Description: Fragment of limestone echinus moulding, consisting of one leaf of a rounded early Ionic cymas. The treatment of the white and chalky limestone with small holes and solid black curst is rather crude.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis) (Attributed by Petrie to the 'first temple of Apollo'.)
Curator's comments: This fragment, together with B397a and B397c, corresponds closely with fragment B397b in terms of type, material and crude artistic treatment. The measurements, however, do not correspond and certain irregularities suggest at least two different original elements for these fragments. Moreover, the profile of the cross-section of this fragment is 1 cm higher than B 397b and also the bridge on the under differs. Published (Koenigs 2007, 317f. Cat. 7; Naukratis 1886, 5f, 13 Pl. 3; Dismoor, AAG, 125ff. Fig. 47; Kirchhoff 1988, 197f, No. E 1; Bakker 1999, 51f, Cym. 1)
Bibliographic references: Sculpture / Catalogue of Greek Sculpture in the British Museum (B397d)
Koenigs 2007 / Archaische griechische Bauteile (Cat. no.7d, pp.317-318, pl.7,8,10,12)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (AA.14) (Phase 3)
